com.brightcove.drm.widevine

Class WidevinePlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brightcove.player.event.AbstractComponent
      • com.brightcove.drm.widevine.WidevinePlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.drm.DrmManagerClient.OnErrorListener, android.drm.DrmManagerClient.OnEventListener, android.drm.DrmManagerClient.OnInfoListener, DrmPlugin, Component

    @Emits(events={"didInterruptContent","didResumeContent","registerPlugin","play","typeAccountAlreadyRegistered","typeAcquireDrmInfoFailed","typeAllRightsRemoved","typeAlreadyRegisteredByAnotherAccount","typeDrmInfoProcessed","typeNotSupported","typeNoInternetConnection","typeOutOfMemory","typeProcessDrmInfoFailed","typeRemoveAllRightsFailed","typeRemoveRights","typeRightsInstalled","typeRightsNotInstalled","typeRightsRemoved","typeRightsRenewalNotAllowed","typeWaitForRights"})
@ListensFor(events={"didSetSource","selectSource","willInterruptContent","willResumeContent"})
public class WidevinePlugin
extends AbstractComponent
implements DrmPlugin, android.drm.DrmManagerClient.OnEventListener, android.drm.DrmManagerClient.OnErrorListener, android.drm.DrmManagerClient.OnInfoListener
    This class implements the DrmPlugin interface for Widevine rights-protected content.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WidevinePlugin

        public WidevinePlugin(android.content.Context context,
              BaseVideoView videoView,
              java.lang.String drmServerUri,
              java.lang.String deviceId,
              java.lang.String portalId)
        Creates a new WidevineClient. Generally, only one WidevineClient should exist at any time for a single Widevine provider. On construction, the WidevineClient automatically registers itself with the Android DRM framework.

      • release

        public void release()
        Description copied from interface: DrmPlugin
        Releases resources associated with the current session. It is considered good practice to call this method when the plugin is no longer needed in your application. After release() is called, the plugin is no longer usable since it has lost all of its required resources.
        Specified by:
        release in interface DrmPlugin

      • register

        public android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void,android.drm.DrmInfo> register()
        Description copied from interface: DrmPlugin
        Registers with the DRM server. Registration must occur before performing most other DRM requests.
        Specified by:
        register in interface DrmPlugin

      • canHandle

        public boolean canHandle(Source source)
        Ideally, we would delegate to the DrmManagerClient, but it naively verifies if it can handle a URL by checking the file extension (or lack thereof). However, it fails if there is a query string, hash, etc. Instead, we check the Source's delivery type, then we check the widevine protocol/scheme, and lastly we look for an extension of ".wvm" anywhere in the string.
        Specified by:
        canHandle in interface DrmPlugin

      • checkRightsStatus

        public android.os.AsyncTask<Source,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Integer> checkRightsStatus(Source source)
        Description copied from interface: DrmPlugin
        Checks whether the given Source has valid rights for DrmStore.Action.DEFAULT. The task's return value is an int representing the DrmStore.RightsStatus of the content.
        Specified by:
        checkRightsStatus in interface DrmPlugin
